question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/lib.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcV2FileStoreBackfillerConfig] [Input Validation] Can an attacker provide a malicious fullnode_grpc_address URL (e.g., file://, javascript:, data:) that bypasses validation and causes the backfiller to connect to unauthorized endpoints or execute arbitrary code? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/lib.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcV2FileStoreBackfillerConfig] [Integer Overflow] Can chain_id be set to u64::MAX or other extreme values that cause integer overflow in downstream arithmetic operations, leading to incorrect version calculations and data corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/lib.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcV2FileStoreBackfillerConfig] [Range Validation] Can starting_version be set greater than ending_version, causing the backfiller to process versions in reverse order or skip validation checks, potentially corrupting the file store? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/lib.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcV2FileStoreBackfillerConfig] [Integer Overflow] Can ending_version - starting_version overflow when both are set to extreme values (e.g., u64::MAX - 1 and u64::MAX), causing incorrect range calculations and missing transaction data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/lib.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcV2FileStoreBackfillerConfig] [Path Traversal] Can progress_file_path contain directory traversal sequences (../, ..\\ ) allowing an attacker to write the progress file to arbitrary system locations and overwrite critical files? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/lib.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcV2FileStoreBackfillerConfig] [Resource Exhaustion] Can backfill_processing_task_count be set to an extremely large value (e.g., usize::MAX or 1000000) causing massive memory allocation and system resource exhaustion leading to DoS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/lib.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcV2FileStoreBackfillerConfig] [Zero Value Attack] Can backfill_processing_task_count be set to 0, causing the backfiller to never process any transactions while appearing to run normally, resulting in silent data loss? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/lib.rs] [Function: default_backfill_processing_task_count()] [Configuration Manipulation] Is the default value of 16 tasks hardcoded without considering system resources, potentially causing resource exhaustion on low-memory systems or underutilization on high-performance systems? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Panic on Failure] Does the .expect() call on line 43 cause the entire backfiller process to panic and terminate when Processor::new fails, leading to unrecoverable service disruption without proper error handling? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Panic on Failure] Does the .expect() call on line 47 cause permanent service termination when processor.run() fails, without any retry mechanism or graceful degradation, leading to data inconsistency if failure occurs mid-backfill? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Error Propagation] Can transient network errors or temporary file store unavailability trigger the panic in run(), causing the backfiller to terminate instead of retrying, resulting in incomplete backfill operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [TOCTOU Race Condition] Between checking file_store.is_initialized() on line 63 and reading metadata on line 65, can an attacker modify or delete the metadata file causing inconsistent state or reading corrupted metadata? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Chain ID Mismatch] Can an attacker replace the file store metadata with a different chain_id after the check on line 66, allowing transactions from wrong chains to be written to the file store and corrupting the indexer data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Integer Overflow] Can num_transactions_per_folder be set to 0 or a value that causes modulo operations on lines 69-70 to panic or produce incorrect results, bypassing version alignment validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Metadata Manipulation] Can an attacker craft malicious metadata with num_transactions_per_folder set to 1 or u64::MAX causing performance degradation or integer overflow in version calculations throughout the backfill process? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Progress File Race Condition] Can concurrent processes or attackers modify the progress file between reading on line 75 and writing on line 87, causing version conflicts or allowing backfill restart from incorrect positions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [JSON Injection] Can an attacker inject malicious JSON into the progress file that, when deserialized on line 76, causes denial of service through deeply nested structures or triggers deserialization vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Time Manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate system time to control the backfill_id generated from UNIX_EPOCH on lines 80-83, causing collisions with other backfill processes or overwriting existing backfill data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [File System Race] Is there a race condition where multiple backfiller instances can simultaneously detect missing progress file and create conflicting initial progress files, leading to duplicate backfill operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Progress File Corruption] Can partial writes or system crashes during progress file write on line 87 leave the file in a corrupted state, causing deserialization failures and preventing backfill restart? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Version Boundary Attack] Can starting_version equal ending_version, bypassing the check on line 100 if they're both multiples of num_transactions_per_folder, causing immediate exit without proper validation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Silent Exit] Does the exit(0) call on line 103 prevent proper cleanup and notification when backfill is already complete, potentially leaving resources locked or failing to signal completion to monitoring systems? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: new()] [Progress Manipulation] Can progress_file.version be manipulated to skip critical transaction ranges by setting it to ending_version - 1, causing incomplete historical data in the file store? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Race Condition in Version Increment] Can concurrent tasks race on the version variable increment on line 207, causing multiple tasks to process the same version range and create duplicate file store entries? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-v2-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill()] [Version Gap Attack] Can version be incremented past ending_version during concurrent execution, causing the backfiller to write transactions beyond the intended range and corrupting subsequent backfill operations? (High)
